meanings.definition: The protective covering of a seed.
meanings.sent1: The seedcases kept the seed safe from harm.
meanings.sent2: I collected the seedcases from various plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The seedcases decided to have a party to celebrate their important job.
meanings.sent4: The seedcases were like tiny suits of armor for the seeds.
meanings.sent5: The shiny seedcases glistened in the sunlight, catching my eye.

meanings.sent1: The seedcases of the pine cone hold many seeds inside.
meanings.sent2: The farmer carefully examined the seedcases of the fruit to check for quality.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the seedcases for tiny houses and tried to move in.
meanings.sent4: The seedcases were like treasure chests full of precious seeds.
meanings.sent5: The seedcases burst open, releasing a shower of seeds onto the ground.

meanings.definition: The outer covering of a seed.
meanings.sent1: The bird pecked at the seedcases to get to the seed inside.
meanings.sent2: The gardener studied the seedcases to learn more about the plant species.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the seedcases as hats for the acorns.
meanings.sent4: The seedcases were like jackets that kept the seeds warm and protected.
meanings.sent5: The delicate seedcases crumbled easily, revealing the tiny seeds within.
